frameworkcore.dbtools

Class SQLUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • frameworkcore.dbtools.SQLUtilities

  • public class SQLUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides all methods required to execute various types of SQL Queries.
    Author:
    Saurav Kumar Sahoo (saurav.kumar.sahoo), Vedhanth Reddy (v.reddy.monajigari)

      • executeSQLQuery

        public java.lang.String executeSQLQuery(java.lang.String sqlQuery)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method executes the query and returns the result as a String.
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - The query with the expected column should be provided between SELECT and FROM. Only one column name is allowed.
        Returns:
        Value as a String from the Column Name in the Query Result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - with SQL Error Code

      • identifyColumnName

        public java.lang.String identifyColumnName(java.lang.String sqlQuery)

      • identifyMultipleColumnNames

        public java.lang.String[] identifyMultipleColumnNames(java.lang.String sqlQuery)

      • executeMultiColumnSQLQuery

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> executeMultiColumnSQLQuery(java.lang.String sqlQuery)
                                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method executes the query and returns the result as a String.
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - The query with the expected column should be provided between SELECT and FROM. Multiple comma separated column names are expected in standard SQL Format is allowed.
        Returns:
        Hashmap of Column Name to Respective Value in the Query Result.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - with SQL Error Code

      • executeUpdateSQLQuery

        public int executeUpdateSQLQuery(java.lang.String sqlQuery)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method executes the update query and returns the count of updated records.
        Parameters:
        sqlQuery - The query with the value should be provided in update query for a particular column. Multiple comma separated column names are expected in standard SQL Format is allowed.
        Returns:
        int: number of records updated by the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - with SQL Error Code
